questions.text: What did Cliff say was the worst way to die?
options: Being runover by a mack truck
questions.explanation:
Being eaten alive by rats.

	It was Frasier who said the worst way to die was to die alone. They made fun of his answer and said he wasn't even trying. Norm said the worst way to die was to slide down a greased banister.

questions.text: What did Lilith ask Norm that made everyone laugh?
questions.explanation:
"What do you drink?".

	Frasier explained that everyone knew that Norm always drank beer. Lilith still didn't see the humor but said it was funny anyway.

questions.text: What did Frasier and Lilith want from Norm?
questions.correct: to paint the nursery for their soon-to-be-born baby
options: nothing, they just wanted to buy him a drink
questions.explanation:
to paint the nursery for their soon-to-be-born baby.

	They said they didn't want any cutesy stuff like "The Smurfs". They also wanted neutral colors so their child would not be bound to certain colors because of its gender.

questions.text: What were the gang doing that Rebecca said could shut the bar down?
questions.explanation:
gambling.

	Gambling in the bar was illegal since no taxes were being paid on the winnings. The guys were having a pool on the game.

Carla and Eddie.

	Carla said it was her second anniversary with Eddie. She was waiting for him to do something special for their anniversary.

questions.text: How much did Woody win in the first pot?
questions.explanation:
$125.

	Woody, who didn't want to be a part of the pool at first, was now gloating that he won. Sam told him that winners who wanted to stay alive didn't brag.

questions.text: How long had Cliff been carrying around a $5 bill his mother gave him?
questions.explanation:
10 years.

	He accidentally put it in the pool pot and Woody got it. Cliff said he wanted it back and gave Woody another $5.

questions.text: What was Eddie's real first name?
questions.explanation:
Guy.

	Guy is a French name and is pronounced Gee, where the G sounds like the G in gorilla. She knew the flowers were not from Eddie because the card was signed Edward LeBec and Edward wasn't his real first name.

questions.text: What did Sam say Mormons couldn't do?
questions.explanation:
dance.

	Rebecca asked why "more men" couldn't send her flowers. Sam thought she said "Mormon" not "more men". So he questioned why Mormons couldn't send flowers. Then he said "I knew they couldn't dance".

questions.text: Who won the last quarter of the pool?
questions.explanation:
Rebecca.

	Rebecca told Woody she was going to show him how a mature person handled winning. Then she said "Read 'em and weep, farm boy!".
